column5: Anyone have a good recipe for a hot toddy? Gotta get this chill outta these bones.
Throw three logs in the fireplace.. go to kitchen.. pour rum, then soda of choice into tall glass... return to living room with same and stand in front of the fireplace. Best I can do Jeff !
Hop in the hot tub it seemed to work last year
Steep in small pot of boiled water: cinnamon sticks, lemon peels, fresh squeezed lemon juice & honey. Divide into mugs, add 1 to 2oz Bourbon to each mug before serving.
Thanks Dan! And to all the rest of yous......
Nothing better then a nice soak in a hot tub for 30 minutes. Then a black coffee with some kalua.
I've been trying the coffee with Baileys and Southern for a while....Ain't quite cuttin it. But thanks Brian.
Whiskey straight up wimp.
My wife got one of these for Christmas. It's very warm... so she says
One of my many favs Jef.  Ya sure ya aint got some bug?????  Take care.
LOL
Just the fishin bug Brian.  Think I have a bottle of cognac a bud dropped off over the holidays.....Gonna go dig that out.
rye and something warm.... usually at 3 am for me...before I was married of course.
Any hard liquor mixed in with a mug of hot neo-citran will do you right cupcake.  (or two   ) Then sleep well  Joey

Hot Toddy Ingredients:  * 1 tblsp Honey * 3/4 glass Tea * 2 shots Brandy * 1 slice Lemon  Mixing instructions:  Brew tea and fill tall glass 3/4 full. Mix in honey. Mix in Brandy shots. Add lemon slice and enjoy.  http://webtender.com (aka bible)
booze and drugs are really not a good idea
Works for me every time!
boiling water in a mug, shot of Crown Royal, tablespoon of honey, smash of lemon juice, smash of apple cider vinegar, mix er up and lap it up, take two and call me in the morning !!!
You might be right but it sure does work well from what I have heard
Is that why Ny Quil has 10% alcohol in it???
Been a long time since my tarbending days...  Hot apple cider with a couple of shots of brandy (cognac)  Stir with a cinnamon stik (optional)
That was always the beverage of choice when rod standing steelies on the cold wind swept shores of G'Bay in winter, and occasionly the warmer days of fall.

Here's my dad's recipe when he felt a little under the weather....  1oz of Dekuyper gin, mix with a table spoon of honey, a few drops of lemon and add boiling water.  Once finished, take a Contact C and go to bed  Leechman
